Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the circumstances surrounding the death of the border patrol agent by suggesting that he was "killed by attackers using rocks" when the cause of his death has not been definitively determined.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence to support the assertion that the border patrol agent was killed by attackers using rocks.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the death of the border patrol agent was a result of an intentional attack with rocks, despite evidence suggesting it was an accidental fall.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation for the death of the border patrol agent, which suggests that he died accidentally by falling down a culvert on a dark night.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the cause of the border patrol agent's death has not yet been definitively determined, yet it asserts that he was killed by attackers using rocks.
Understate: The claim may understate the complexity of the situation by simplifying it to a single cause of death without considering other factors or possibilities.
Falters at times: The claim falters by presenting conflicting information about the circumstances surrounding the death of the border patrol agent, which may lead to confusion or uncertainty.
